mcscript.utils.CommandFormatter module¶

class mcscript.utils.CommandFormatter.CommandFormatter(context: Dict[str, Any])¶

Bases: string.Formatter

Advanced format mini-language.

Features:

  • numeric placeholders and empty placeholders get replaced with empty strings

  • placeholder names that are not specified don’t throw an error and instead write an empty string

  • if a placeholder name is not specified it can write a default value which is specified after a colon:

    • if it does not contain a dot it is the literal default value

    • if it does contain a dot a value of one of the in commands defined enums will be used

Examples

format("Text") -> Text

format("{greeting:hello}, {}{world}, world="world")!" -> "hello, world!"

format("{greeting:hello}, {}{world}, greeting="servus", world="world")!" -> "servus, world!"

format("property: {:Config.currentConfig.NAME}") -> <depending on config>"property: McScript"

DEFAULT_STRING = ''¶
format_field(value, format_spec)¶
get_field(field_name: str, args, kwargs)¶

” Utilities for the command line interface.

class mcscript.utils.cmdHelper.MCWorld(folderOrLevel)¶

Bases: object

A simple object to represent a single minecraft world.

mcscript.utils.cmdHelper.generateFiles(world: mcscript.utils.cmdHelper.MCWorld, datapack: mcscript.utils.Datapack.Datapack, name='McScript')¶

saves the datapack for world.

Parameters

  • world (MCWorld) – the minecraft world

  • datapack (Datapack) – the ‘Datapack’ object

  • name (str) – the name of the datapack, default “McScript”

mcscript.utils.cmdHelper.getWorld(name, path='C:\\Users\\david\\AppData\\Roaming\\.minecraft\\saves') → Optional[mcscript.utils.cmdHelper.MCWorld]¶

Returns a world that is located in path and named name

Parameters

  • name – The name of the world. Not the folder name

  • path – the path of the directory that contains this world

Returns

a MCWorld instance if found or None
